oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Oklahoma Roundup - 1948-04-05 - KOMA - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part two of a performance from the Oklahoma Roundup radio program on April 5, 1948 on radio station KOMA (Oklahoma City, Okla). Staff includes Perry Ward (master of ceremonies), Mac Fuller [phonetic] (writer), and Kenyon Brown (producer).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Lem Hawkins; Thomas Family Trio; Julian Akins; Jack Beasley; Cowboy Jess
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) Opening theme and statements / (1:05) Lem Hawkins performs "Barrel Polka" / (2:30) Perry Ward and Lem Hawkins tell a joke / (2:55) The Thomas Family Trio performs "(Gotta Get To) Oklahoma City" / (5:02) Julian Akin performs "[Unidentified song]" / (7:00) Perry Ward and Lem Hawkins tell a joke / (7:48) Jack Beasley performs "Darling Nelly Gray" / (10:31) Perry Ward announces a United States savings bond advertisement / (11:26) [Unidentified] performs "[Unidentified song]" / (12:06) Cowboy Jess performs "Goodbye, Good Luck My Darling" [unconfirmed] / (14:17) Closing theme and statements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Oklahoma Roundup; KOMA (Radio station : Oklahoma City, Okla.); CBS Inc.; Ward, Perry, 1914-1989; Beasley, Jack
